author: senh
title: Analysis: Reduced Competition Hikes Air Fares
text: BING NEWS: Reduced Competition Nudges Airline Fares Higher, Analysis Shows The wave of consolidation that swept the U.S. airline industry has markedly reduced competition at many of the nation's major airports, and passengers appear to be paying the price in higher fares and fees, an Associated Press analysis has found. 07/14/2015 - 4:01 pm | View Link Airfare hikes less likely, more limited, expert says Good news for airline travelers: Airfare hikes have become less common and, typically, target specific types of fliers or those in limited geographical areas. That is the analysis of the ... in the last few years has reduced competition and increased ... 06/14/2015 - 7:04 am | View Link Cebu Pacific soars above competition – think tank In a recent analysis entitled “Cebu Pacific domestic ... sale of Zest Airways Corp. of Ambassador Alfredo Yao to Air Asia Philippines Inc., as well as Tigerair Philippines to Cebu Pacific, reduced the number of competitors on domestic trunk routes ... 05/2/2015 - 9:00 am | View Link Explainer: fuel hedging and its impact on airlines and airfares The Australian Competition & Consumer Commission is ... are particularly exposed to fuel price changes, as they have reduced all other costs (such as staff costs) to a minimum. For example, Air Asia’s aircraft fuel expenses are around 47%. 01/29/2015 - 11:55 pm | View Link Falling rates ‘fine’ – as long as costs fall faster, major container lines warn You can forget freight rate hikes –‘sub-economic’ rates on the main tradelanes are here to stay, according to leading shipping lines meeting at the this ... impact of mega-alliances on pricing or reduced competition for his business.
